storyInfo: While retreating from the factory, Horn runs into Manfred.

attributes.content: So you mean to say that Hoederer has failed?
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Yes, General. I saw it with my own eyes. He was gravely wounded in the battle just now.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: And he was in contact with another Sarkaz woman, aside from his longtime mercenary acquaintance?
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Right. But she's... highly skilled at concealment, and moves too quickly.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: I was anxious about getting too close. Couldn't shake the feeling she'd notice me with one wrong step.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: Wise choice. You wouldn't have made it back alive otherwise.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: That said, I'm surprised the Confessarius let Babel's assassin go free. Was that an oversight, or their intent?
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: ...No matter.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Tell me about Hoederer. Where is he?
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: He's still marshaling the remaining mercenaries, and about to resume pursuing the escaped convicts.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: Have him return. Those convicts will not stay free forever.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: General?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: As you said, his wounds are no laughing matter.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Forgive me, but why do you still trust Hoederer so much?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: I've had you with him this whole time.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Correct me if I'm wrong, but you've never once reported any misdeeds from him.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: But he used to work for Babel!
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: It was the mercenaries under his watch that screwed up, and it was his old friend that incited them! Don't you think it's too risky to keep him in such a key position, General?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: You've seen for yourself today. How does one Victorian regard another?
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Urgh...
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: And how much more difficult do you think it is for one Sarkaz to trust another?
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: We've had everything stolen from us, been forced to grow accustomed to fighting each other for the right to survive.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: And now, we've obtained a new opportunity.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: You tell me, do you want to go back to monitoring a possible Sarkaz spy, or will you accompany me in eliminating the remaining Victorian threats?
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: General, we choose to go with you.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: *pant*... *pant*... Did we shake them?
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: We can't let our guards down yet, Mr. Feist.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: I know... *huff*... I know.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: ...Captain.
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: What is it?
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Your face is splattered in blood.
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: Blood?! Hey, Bill... Bill?
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Nrgh...
attributes.name: Bill

attributes.content: ...Oh, it's just my own blood. No need to panic, then.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Come on, Bill, you could breathe a little louder! I don't want to have spent all this effort porting a dead man back.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Then think about... swinging your spanner gentler.
attributes.name: Bill

attributes.content: You're always... hitting me... in the head...
attributes.name: Bill

attributes.content: I hear you. You're the boss today.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Hold on a little longer... we'll be right back home soon. Right? I'm not going blind, am I?
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Eugh, this blood from my forehead's getting in my eyes a little... Rockrock, eyes out. How much left to our target rendezvous?
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: A little over 300 meters and we're there.
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: It's Team 6 on guard here, right? I could really use a hand from them. Bill, old bud, you're getting harder to carry by the second.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: ...How long have we gone without a signal from the surface team?
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Didn't the Doctor say they'd only contact us after they reach that last RDV?
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: No, I mean the Self-Salvation Corps, at the one before that.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: We had an agreement that they'd keep us up to date with the surface situation every half hour.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Shit, I wasn't tracking the time! How long's it been?
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: ...We need to go up and see.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: No!
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: If the Sarkaz have already discovered our last rendezvous, then the Doctor's squad is in danger. You're clearly worried sick about Morgan and Dagda too.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: A... And you too!
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Worst comes to worst, Vina, I go peek, and you stay here. Suppose somehow something's happened, you scarper further in...
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Indra, I can't always keep cowering behind you all. First our mentor, then you and the Glasgow Gang, now the Doctor—
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: —I've cowered for far too long, and I know it. Dagda wasn't talking nonsense. If you're always tucked away in the shadows, you gradually lose the courage to directly face the sun.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: She's trying to nark you! You know what she's dying for? You, taking her to storm the Palace, and finding that what's-his-gent to do him in!
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: And you're itching to go back to the Glasgow Gang. Don't you understand her point of view?
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: I... Like hell I don't, but that's the bloody thing. I understand, and that's why...
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: You're scared she'll end up killing herself, the way she rushes it.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: You can bloody imagine, can't you? She's got a death wish in my eyes, the way she acts!
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: ...You need to trust her.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: She'll be willing to live for our sake... and the sake of so many, even if it comes with enormous pain.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: She's an outstanding knight, and a warrior of Victoria. She has everything in common with the countless others who struggle to live, and fight on for Victoria.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: And I... I have to fight with them. Not because I'm in some special position, but because we're all 'native' to this land.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Vina...
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Think of that commander, Lady Clovisia. Would she abandon her soldiers, run off just to keep herself safe?
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: I'm not familiar with her... but I don't imagine she would. Those soldiers really trust in her.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Then in your eyes, how much do I pale in comparison?
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Like bloody hell you pale at all!
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Then follow me. Together, we'll make sure that our comrades-in-arms have a safe trip home.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: We finally get to leave this stinking place soon.
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: Are you alright, 'Spy'?
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: ...Whoof... *huff*... I'm fine, Mandragora.
attributes.name: Taran Secret Agent

attributes.content: The last few times I've heard the word 'spy' it's been from a Sarkaz thinking up some fresh new punishment. I almost forgot it was my codename.
attributes.name: Taran Secret Agent

attributes.content: Then pick a more tasteful one next time, if you have the chance. 'The Elocutionist' and all that lot had good ones, and they kicked the bucket without leaving so much as a smear.
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: Haha...
attributes.name: Taran Secret Agent

attributes.content: Save your strength for now. The Leader still needs the Sarkaz intel you found.
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: You mean... The Shard...
attributes.name: Taran Secret Agent

attributes.content: No, don't say it.
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: Not like I don't want to hear, but... we need the Leader's approval. Our soldiers are all clean sorts. Don't go giving them too big a burden to carry.
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: I understand... Mandragora... you've always been such a good girl.
attributes.name: Taran Secret Agent

attributes.content: Don't sweet-talk me like 'The Bandit' did. Sick of it. They're all gone and now I'm stuck here alone in this shithole having to worry about the Leader.
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: At least you got back quick. While you were gone, that Harmonie bastard was glued to the Leader's side day and night, and I was terrified that... that...
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: Terrified... that what?
attributes.name: Taran Secret Agent

attributes.content: That the Leader would get too close to those noble sorts, and that someday, she'd have no more use for us.
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: The Leader, eh... *sigh*...
attributes.name: Taran Secret Agent

attributes.content: Ma'am, I've ascertained the others' positions. They're still in the same place, watching the door for the Sarkaz. Are we linking up with them right now?
attributes.name: Dublinn Soldier

attributes.content: Mm. Get the paramedics going. 'The Spy' needs immediate treatment.
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: Right, one more thing. Find a Messenger and notify Count Mourning outside the city immediately. We have to ensure 'The Spy' meets the Leader as soon as possible.
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: Count Mourning? You... involved him for the Leader?
attributes.name: Taran Secret Agent

attributes.content: Tch. Times like these, we have no choice but to hope the nobles do something to help. Funny kind of joke, isn't it?
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: *cough* *cough*... You... You've grown well...
attributes.name: Taran Secret Agent

attributes.content: That's not like you, 'Spy'. You're speaking too much rubbish. Save the rest for when you're not ragged enough to drop dead at a stiff breeze.
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: ...Hold it.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: What is it, Horn? We have a visual on the exit already.
attributes.name: Robben

attributes.content: Mind the perimeter.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Three o'clock!
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Horn, it's Sarkaz!
attributes.name: Robben

attributes.content: Robben, are you still fine for ammo?
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Ha... haha... sorry, Horn. Truth is, I've been hiding an explosive shell on me.
attributes.name: Robben

attributes.content: All this time, I've had it in my head that if I fall into the enemy's hands at some point again... I'll be taking this shell with me to my last stand.
attributes.name: Robben

attributes.content: ...Shame, we improvised that shell ourselves.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: How's that got anything to do with—
attributes.name: Robben

attributes.content: And I'm very sorry, but I'm not inclined to give you that opportunity.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Eh? My shell—
attributes.name: Robben

attributes.content: Looks like the power of a homemade one falls a bit short after all.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: But... but he's unscathed, how?
attributes.name: Robben

attributes.content: That Sarkaz...
attributes.name: Robben

attributes.content: That Sarkaz is their beloved General.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: We finally meet. An improvised shell is hardly a suitable greeting though.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: I know you've met your share of Victorian soldiers, Sarkaz. After all, a great deal of them died by your hands. I imagine their spirits are practically lining up to crowd your dreams.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: No need to be so self-effacing, White Wolf of Victoria.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Even to the Sarkaz, you qualify as a heroic warrior.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: As I recall, the captain who rendered Kazdel a sea of flames once more, two hundred years ago, was your ancestor.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Are you some monster who's lived for centuries too?
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: I had no chance to witness that war.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: But listen to the way you talk about it. It's no different from your kin who feed on others' lives to prolong their own.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: 'Those stained in Sarkaz blood must pay that blood back, thousands of times over.'
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Where do you think we came from, Victorian? Just who runs in fear at the restless souls circling Londinium's skies day and night, murmuring their blood feuds?
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Did you know? I became a professional soldier precisely because I was fed up with justifying this war we're in.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Come, Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: The words of the deceased lingering about my ears are more than you'll ever hear.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: And I promised them... I promised them this.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: I will not fall until I see my people out of this place alive.
attributes.name: Horn
